Description: Small amulet in glazed composition, in the form of a highly stylised frog; pierced transversely for suspension; greenish glaze, very abraded, patchily preserved; buff brown core; very worn surface.
Curator's comments: Since the piece is very poorly preserved, it is not possible to say if it is an amulet or a scaraboid in the shape of a frog or toad (such scaraboids are well attested: Hornung, Staehelin 1976, nos. 364, 621, 762, D 26 and D 30). On frog or toad amulets as symbols of regeneration and fecundity, see: Andrews 1994, 63; Herrmann et al. 2010, 116-117 (type 65). Andrews, C. 1994, Amulets of Ancient Egypt, London. Herrmann, C., Staubli, T., Berger-Lober, S., Keel, O., Schönbächler, G. 2010, 1001 Amulett : altägyptischer Zauber, monotheisierte Talismane, säkulare Magie, Bibel+Orient-Museum, Liebefeld, Stuttgart. Hornung, E. and Staehelin, E. 1976, Skarabäen und andere Siegelamulette aus Basler Sammlungen, Ägyptische Denkmäler in der Schweiz I, nos. 364, 621, 762, D 26 and D 30.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OK.272) (phase 3)
